About - Rooftop 1WLO Skip to content Rooftop 1WLO Menu About Private Events Celebrations Reserve Contact TRP Taste Blog Menu About Private Events Celebrations Reserve Contact TRP Taste Blog About Rooftop @1WLO Elevated above Fort Lauderdale‚Äôs renowned Las Olas Boulevard and the New River. Welcome to Rooftop @1WLO, Fort Lauderdale‚Äôs premier rooftop bar experience. The open-air patio will transport patrons to a garden in the sky, surrounded by panoramic views of Fort Lauderdale‚Äôs majestic skyline. This eclectic lounge features bar seating throughout, complemented by lush natural d√©cor in a swanky, laid back atmosphere. Our resident mixologists stirring up an ever-evolving selection of hand-crafted, ingredient-focused creations, paired with lite bites for guests to taste and enjoy as the sun sets and the night ignites. Located in the heart of downtown, Rooftop @1WLO creates the perfect backdrop for an unforgettable night out. Elevated Cocktails At Rooftop @1WLO, we focus on offering a relaxed, open-air ambiance paired with expertly crafted cocktails and light bites. Staff and Board ‚Äì Rooftop Films Our Impact Support Us Donate / Memberships 2025 Sponsorships Rooftop Merch A/V Rentals For Filmmakers Submit a Film for 2025 The Rooftop Filmmakers Fund About Jobs & Volunteer Opportunities Press Meet The Team Schedule Follow Instagram X/Twitter Facebook Newsletter Staff and Board STAFF Kate Gellene, Head of Operations Kate (she/her) joined the Rooftop Films team as an intern in the fall of 2011 and wore many hats before heading the operations department in 2014‚Äîincluding event management, fundraising & membership, and social media. Born and raised in New Jersey, Kate studied Cinema Studies with a minor in French at NYU‚Äôs Tisch School of the Arts. During the summer, Kate can (occasionally) be found making your drink at the after-party. Or at the beach. Saidah Russell, Head of Programming Saidah (she/her) joined the Rooftop Films team in 2022 and previously worked full time in film exhibition at an arthouse theater in Westchester, NY. She has experience working on screening committees for several festivals, including the Sundance Film Festival, Hamptons International Film Festival, and Indie Memphis Film Festival. She is the Director of Programming for the TIDE Film Festival, an emerging Brooklyn-based festival dedicated to showcasing work by filmmakers of color. Kristen Kelley Rand, Head of Marketing and Communications Originally from just north of Boston, Kristen (she/her) is an actress and writer who earned her bachelor‚Äôs at New York University‚Äôs Gallatin School, where‚Äîpursuing as well-rounded an arts education possible‚Äîshe designed her own interdisciplinary program marrying the studies of performance, production, and marcom. She came to Rooftop following tenure at Universal Pictures, W Magazine, and inside the halls of the McKittrick Hotel with Punchdrunk‚Äôs Sleep No More . She credits her maternal gram (and Julia Roberts) with helping shape her into the rom-com savant she is today, and firmly believes you should eliminate the term ‚Äúguilty pleasure‚Äù from your vocabulary if you haven‚Äôt already. Langston Sanchez, Head of Technical Operations Langston (he/him) is a media technician and event producer who strives to combine a DIY ethos with seamless production to create high-quality, accessible events in his native New York City. After graduating from Hampshire College with a B.A. in Film and Video Art, Langston‚Äôs work has spanned both production and media education, with experience at institutions such as the Cooper Union, Apollo Theater, DOC NYC, Maysles Documentary Center, and the Sundance Film Festival. When not working alongside his team, Langston attempts to strike a balance between chronically online and blissfully unaware. Isabella Jackson, Programmer Isabella (she/her) is a writer and dancer from a tiny town in Pennsylvania. She came to New York to study Dance and Film at The New School, and went on to get her MFA in Screenwriting from Brooklyn College. She‚Äôs passionate about independent filmmaking, having worked in and around the industry since 2014 with IFP, The Hamptons International Film Festival, Montclair Film Festival, NewFest, and DOCNYC. Outside of festivals, she works in TV as a Writer‚Äôs Assistant and Script Coordinator. In the world, you can find her listening to disco, writing strange stories, or watching a campy horror flick. Hilina Kidane, Programmer Hilina (she/her) began with Rooftop Films as Volunteer Coordinator before joining the programming team. She‚Äôs worked across a number of film festivals and is currently full-time at the New York International Children‚Äôs Film Festival, where she supports youth-enrichment programs. Darby Puckett, Programmer Darby (she/her) is an actress and filmmaker from Virginia Beach, VA. She started at Rooftop as an intern, and that‚Äôs when the addiction to watching short films began. Aside from film watching, she‚Äôs usually training for a random half marathon, memorizing lines, or dream-casting Broadway musicals. Mariales Diaz, Programming Assistant Mariales Diaz (they/them) is a gender-expansive Dominican writer, director, producer, and programmer living in New York. Their storytelling explores experiences that exist at the intersection of survival and love. Diaz has worked on the production and post-archival teams at companies such as Pilgrim Media Group, Religion of Sports, HBO Max, and Proximity Media. They are a graduate of the SUNY Purchase Film Conservatory and a 2024 Sundance Institute Trans Possibilities Fellow. They also have participated in fellowships and artist programs such as Film at Lincoln Center‚Äôs Artist Academy, Sundance Ignite, Creative Culture at The Jacob Burns Film Center, and NeXt Doc. C. ‚ÄúMeaks‚Äù Meaker, Venue Manager Meaks (they/them) is a writer whose work often explores queerness, monstrosity, and the end of the world. Their plays have been performed and developed across the United States, including the Kennedy Center, Seattle Repertory Theatre, San Francisco Playhouse, Annex Theatre in Seattle, and About Face in Chicago. They are a Stranger Award Genius Nominee and Gregory Award Outstanding New Play Nominee. They are a former Jerome Fellow at the Playwrights‚Äô Center, an alumna of Seattle Repertory Theatre‚Äôs Writers Group, and former Walter E. Dakin Fellow at Sewanee Writers‚Äô Conference. Their essay ‚ÄúS(wallow)‚Äù won the Editor‚Äôs Prize at Porter House Review and they were a Creative Nonfiction Fellow at Lambda Literary. They received an MFA in Playwriting from University of Iowa‚Äôs Playwrights Workshop. When they‚Äôre not managing venues for Rooftop, they teach writing at City College of New York. Madeline Chandler, Volunteer and Local Partnerships Coordinator Madeline (she/her) does not stop talking about being from Pittsburgh, doing her undergrad at Penn State, and doing her post-grad degrees at the University of Glasgow in Scotland. If you ever want to talk about coffee, hippos or other round animals, ice breakers, or why teen movies are misunderstood, Madeline‚Äôs your girl! Tess Meersman, Festival Assistant Tess (she/her) is a filmmaker and artist who began working for Rooftop Films in 2024 after graduating from Emerson College with a degree in Film Production and double minor in Gender & Sexuality Studies and Literature. Her work has been featured in the GRRL HAUS Cinema screening series, Revolutions per Minute festival, Huret & Spector Gallery, Karen Aqua Gallery, and the Gravitational Lensing film series. When not at work, you can find her rewatching The X Files or making a collage with her beautiful cat, Hitch. Elevated above Fort Lauderdale√¢¬Ä¬ôs renowned Las Olas Boulevard and the New River, perched on the seventh floor of the One West Las Olas building, the Rooftop @1WLO brings a large slice of cosmopolitan vibes to the heart of downtown. Dressed as a garden in the sky, the spacious and trendy rooftop comes with a very lush and natural decor, all surrounded by panoramic views over the Fort Lauderdale skyline. Up here you can enjoy a great selection of hand-crafted, ingredient-focused cocktails created by the resident mixologists. If you want that extra special experience, go for the 'cocktail cart', where you have your own personal bartender mixing cocktails table side. The rooftop menu also includes a nice array of wines and a selection of chef driven and seasonal small plates and shareables. Every Sunday, food, Bottomless Moet and other goodies are served as rooftop brunch. Filled with a swanky, laid back atmosphere, Rooftop @1WLO is a prime spot for eclectic and elevated lounge vibes. And while reservations are not required, they are highly recommended. Frequently Asked Questions | FAQs | Rooftop @1WLO Skip to content Rooftop 1WLO Menu About Private Events Celebrations Reserve Contact TRP Taste Blog Menu About Private Events Celebrations Reserve Contact TRP Taste Blog Rooftop @1WLO FAQ Welcome to the Rooftop @1WLO FAQ page! Here, you‚Äôll find answers to the most common questions our guests ask about dining, events, and more at Fort Lauderdale‚Äôs top rooftop bar destination. Reservations & Seating Are reservations required? Reservations at Rooftop are highly recommended as seating is limited but they are not required. The Rooftop experience is designed to last two hours and we ask that you keep that in mind while enjoying your cocktails. All guests must be 21+ with valid ID. Do you take walk-ins? Absolutely. You are more than welcome to walk in, but making a reservation will guarantee you a seating space for a two-hour window and expedited access to the Rooftop if there is a line to get in. All guests must be 21+ to enter. How many guests can I make a reservation for? We can accommodate any size group between 2-10 guests. If your party is larger than 18 guests send your request on our website‚Äôs contact form or call 954-523-1956 Any parties over 18 guests are encouraged to contact our events department. We are pleased to offer several different event options for larger party sizes, including full buyouts of Rooftop for up to 200 guests. How long is the reservation? The Rooftop experience is designed to last two hours and we ask that you keep that in mind while enjoying your cocktails. Can I make a reservation on the same day? Yes, reservations can be booked 30 mins before opening each day. What should I do if I am running late? If you do not arrive within 15 minutes of your reservation time, there may be a delay in seating you or possible cancellation. I can‚Äôt make my reservation. How do I cancel it? Per the terms of service at the time of reservation, all sales are final and non-refundable but fully transferable to another guest, not a future date. For further assistance, send us a message on our contact form or call 954-523-1956 What does the deposit go towards? The deposit is required to book the reservation. It is applied to the final bill (tax and gratuity not included) at the time of the reservation. If the final bill does not reach the total deposit, there are no refunds or transfers. Age & Entry Policies Are there any age restrictions? Yes. All guests must be 21 years of age or older to access Rooftop. Parking & Access Where should I park? Valet service is available in the parking lot next door to Rooftop (201 South Andrews Avenue). Wednesday: No Valet Thursday: 4pm-1am Friday: 4pm-2am Saturday: 12pm-2am Sunday: No Valet There are also multiple parking garages in the surrounding area. Can I smoke at Rooftop? We are a non-smoking building. If you would like to smoke, you are more than welcome to head downstairs to do so. Please notify the doorman so he knows to give you expedited re-entry. Food & Drink Do you all serve any food items? Yes. Rooftop offers a selection of chef driven small plates and shareable items with a menu changing based on the freshest seasonal ingredients. Can you accommodate any food allergies and special requests? We would like to! Our staff is trained to be highly knowledgeable about what ingredients are in our dishes and cocktails and they can direct our guests to the appropriate items to order. How late is the kitchen open? Our kitchen is open Wed & Thursday 4pm-11pm, Friday & Saturday 2pm- Midnight & Sunday 2pm-9pm. Do you offer drink specials? Yes, we have a variety of drink specials, including unique cocktails and seasonal offerings. Check with our staff or visit during happy hour for the latest deals. Is there a Happy Hour? Happy Hour is Wednesday, Thursday & Friday from 4pm to 7pm, Saturday 2pm -7pm and Sunday, 12pm to 10pm. $7 Tito‚Äôs, Don Julio, Bulleit, and Bacardi cocktails, $8 select nibbles, and $10 craft cocktails. Do you have Brunch? We are open Sundays at 12pm. We feature brunch and bottomless till 4pm. Can I bring in my own wine? We do not allow any outside beverages to be consumed at Rooftop. If I am celebrating a birthday, am I able to bring in my own dessert and balloons? We do indeed allow outside cakes to be brought in for reservations however they will incur a $3 per person Presentation & Cutting Fee. Dress Code Is there a dress code? Rooftop asks that you keep your attire elevated when joining us. No gym wear, beach wear, tank-top, jerseys, or athletic hats. Gratuity & Payments Is gratuity included for reservations? No. 18% gratuity and state sales tax are an additional fee when guests are closing out the tab. Private Events Do you have private events? We are pleased to offer several different event options for larger party sizes starting at 18 people, including full buyouts of Rooftop for up to 200 guests. Our experienced events team assists in all aspects of planning and customization to ensure an unforgettable experience for you and your guests. For bookings and inquiries, visit our Private Event page on our website or call 954-525-9001. Our Business Housing associations (also called Registered Providers) are governed by their √¢¬Ä¬òrules√¢¬Ä¬ô which define our not-for-profit objectives, shareholding membership and constitute the Board as our governing body. Board members have a wide range of skills and experience reflecting the services we provide, our customers and the size and financial complexity and strength of the business. Each association has a Board but the members combine their functions through a single governance meeting that is held six times during the year. Take a Virtual Tour Take a Virtual Tour Private Events & Dining FAQs What is the food and beverage minimum for private events? A food & beverage minimum is defined as the total food & beverage sales, prior to gratuity, service fee & tax. The minimums are based on date, time frame and the room size, not by the number of guests that are attending your event. If your total bill falls short of reaching the food & beverage minimum, the difference will be billed as a Room Rental fee. What is the deposit amount for private events? In order to secure your event, a deposit is due upon signing your contract. Your first deposit is 50% of your food and beverage minimum. What is the sales tax and service fees for private events? All food and beverage prices are subject to a service charge of 20% (6% Banquet Service Charge and 14% Staff Gratuity). A 7% sales tax is applied on all food, beverage and the banquet service charge. All additional charges incurred during the event will be charged to the credit card on file unless otherwise specified. If your group is tax exempt you need to provide us your DR-14 form when sending in the contract. What are the menu selections for private events? Menus must be selected ten business days prior to your event. If menu selections are not received by this deadline, chef‚Äôs choice will apply. Guest counts dropping below 15 guests at least five days prior may be subject to chef‚Äôs choice of menu. Does Rooftop accommodate dietary restrictions for private events? We are happy to accommodate a wide range of special dietary needs and restrictions. Prior to signing off on your Banquet Event Order, please specify restrictions with your Event Manager. What are Rooftop‚Äôs policies on decorations for private events? Event Sections are available one hour prior to your event to allow for decorating. If you need additional time, a $150 charge will apply for each additional hour or fraction. Decorators must follow the decoration policies, Absolutely no tape on wall papered walls, no staples or nails on any interior materials. NO Glitter, Confetti or Wax Candles are allowed to be used. In the event that such materials are used which cause damage, a damage fee will be applied toward the final bill. We are not responsible for any items left after an event and do not guarantee the security of those items. What are the parking accommodations for private events? Valet services are available, either hosted by your group, or paid by any individuals who use the service. Self valet is $7 for 2 hours, and $3 for each additional hour. What is the final guaranteed guest count for private events? A guaranteed guest count is required no later than 3 business days prior to the date of the event. This number will be considered the guarantee not subject to change. If no guarantee is received, Rooftop will use the number of guests estimated on the original contract at time of the booking. There are no exceptions concerning this guarantee & the guarantee must be emailed to the Event Coordinator. What is the cancellation policy for private events? In the unlikely event you should cancel, all deposits are nonrefundable. In the event of a cancellation within seven days of the scheduled event, the client will be responsible for payment of 50% of the estimated food & beverage plus 7% sales tax & 20% gratuity. If the client cancels before seven days of the scheduled event, there will be no penalty, except the nonrefundable deposit.
